utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: So, then, they say they're upset because our border Doocy uses drones. And they'd prefer that he uses a tripod because the drone takes too much of a dramatic kind of footage. Now, this is the same political party that hired a Hollywood producer to produce a mini-series about January 6th, with crying sound effects and about a thousand different camera angles. Then they said they're mad at our border Doocy because DeSantis leaked to him. They told him that he was going to do the flights to Martha's Vineyard. I mean, at least DeSantis tells them that he's doing this. Biden just flies them anywhere. Doesn't tell anybody what he's doing. He does it in secret. And then they complained about the lack of nuance. They're saying that he focuses too much on the number of the migrants. And instead of explaining the root causes of the situation. Now I've heard the border Doocy explained the root causes and he says the causes are coming from the White House. They designated all the Trump border policies. They'd stopped building the border wall and they've encouraged them to come over and they're giving them free bus passes and free plane tickets. The bottom line is this. There's only one reporter on the border.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: They don't want even one.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: that's what they don't want.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: that's a great point. Although border Doocy just sounds like something disgusting you find when there's no bathroom around. Judge, you know, what's interesting. He, OK, they're calling him irritating, but remember we used to feel that Jim Acosta was irritating, but his irritating was obnoxiously ideological, where this is just a guy who's just reporting on things.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Yes. All of a sudden, the facts and the truth are not what they're concerned about. They really think -- Karine Jean-Pierre says, I don't know why we would reach out to them. They don't want a solution. They're putting people's lives at risk. So now she's talking about people like Bill Melugin, he's not looking for a solution. He's just reporting the facts. Well, isn't that what Bill Melugin is supposed to do? And what's amazing is when Karine Jean-Pierre, she starts talking about the fact that this is all new. How is this new that we've got these 18 months? We've been watching these individuals from Cuba, Nicaragua and Venezuela, and, you know, what's amazing? Today, I think it was Ned Price who was on the channel and he was talking about all the successful efforts they've made to try to resolve the crisis. And he talks about this summit that they had of the Western Hemisphere this past summer to deal with these issues. And guess who wasn't invited. Cuba, Nicaragua and Venezuela. I mean, they -- they don't even talk to them.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Let alone, try to figure out how to resolve the issue. And you know what, they want to put the burden on Bill Melugin to decide what are the root causes? Isn't that supposed to be Kamala's job?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: He's doing a better job than Kamala.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: He is.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: He is.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: He should be the vice president.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: At least he shows up every day.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, that's true. that's true. And he doesn't have an annoying laugh. Harold, it seems to me that whenever a problem is illustrated it's either called a stunt or an irritation. What do you think?

utterances.speaker: HAROLD FORD, JR., FOX NEWS CO-HOST
utterances.utterance: Well, I think everything that's been said is right here. Bill Melugin should be applauded for what he's doing. You only criticize, and Dana has a much more informed perspective on this, but politicians who criticize the press should only be critical. It should say they're -- there's only credibility behind a criticism. If you're saying you're not telling the whole story. There's a part of the story I like for you guys to uncover, here's some additional information. There's no additional information here. We have a national security crisis at our border. I do wish, that instead of directing anger at reporters, and every president has a reporter or a couple of reporters they don't like because oftentimes they're asking questions that are irritating. And if you would just answer the question, maybe -- maybe the question would indeed go away. But we don't have a policy at our border and we need one. It's a national security threat and we ought to treat it at that. I've said before, I believe we should build a wall. I believe we should invest in that hemisphere. I believe we should have a streamline asylum process to make it where everyone coming here doesn't believe they're going to get in, just because they have a story that is horrifying and gut wrenching. We need to have a transparent, immigration system that spells out for every migrant or immigrant that comes here. How you achieve legal citizenship. Think about the people who waited five, seven, 10, 15 years to get in the country. Did it legally. Watching this it's a front to them. It's front and a front to the country, a front to our values. And there's no policy that anyone can articulate. Please, don't -- and don't criticize Bill Melugin. Get us a policy at the border.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, it goes back to the -- we love immigrants coming here because immigrants generally love the country more in times, but we also like -- we don't like line crossing.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You got to wait in line. We like hairlines too, apparently.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: We were talking about this in the break yesterday. It sounds like it's too unbelievable. But we were talking about how Venezuela was emptying their prisons.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Isn't this something that maybe our government should be looking into?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Don't you think, yes. Don't you think you want to check that out?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I guess they're busy going to the school board meetings.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes, but what's the nuance really?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Like don't we have some nuance. So, this is a wonderful story. It's my favorite story. In addition to the migrants being bust. Because here's a -- here's a little thing that happened. Last night when this story broke in playbook, Politico playbook. I sent it to Bill Melugin right away. I said, wow, wow, wow, you got under their skin. And he said, what's playbook, which was the best answer he could ever have given because he's so not a D.C. guy.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: He's a reporter doing his job. And you know, along with Griff Jenkins, Casey Stegall, Matt Finn, Alexis McAdams, amongst others. All they're doing is making the White House look like Baghdad Bob. They're out there saying the border is secure. The border is secure. The border is secure. In the meantime, it's like, we're just showing you the pictures every single morning, Hemmer and I laugh. When you go to the reporter at the border, they'll say, well, Dana, 200 migrants just walked across the border. Twenty migrants are lined up over here. It's unbelievable. And they have the -- the White House has downplayed everything. Gas price. Inflation. They got, remember they got mad at reporters for saying that inflation --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Crime.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: -- I might not be in transitory? Crime, Afghanistan, baby formula. And now you have the border. So, I think it's also pretty funny that the only reason the media is covering the border story today is because the White House is mad at a Fox reporter and they let it out.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: It's my favorite story.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: There you go. All right. Coming up, Vladimir Putin makes a serious nuclear threat. Is Biden up for the task.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: He's not bluffing. Vladimir Putin making a chilling threat of nuclear war and trying to upstage President Biden's big speech to the United Nations. The Russian leader calling up hundreds of thousands of reservists to fight Ukraine following frontline setbacks in the war there, while claiming he is not bluffing when it comes to his nuclear threats. Here's Biden hours later.

utterances.speaker: JOE BIDEN, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA
utterances.utterance: Putin has made over nuclear threats against Europe and a reckless disregard for the responsibilities of the non-proliferation regime. This war it's about extinguishing Ukraine's right to exist as a state, plain and simple, and Ukraine's right to exist as a people. Whoever you are, wherever you live, whatever you believe that should not -- that should make your blood run cold.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Biden did get to speak about his favorite topic.

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.utterance: I've signed a historic piece of legislation here in the United States. that includes the biggest, most important climate commitment we have ever made in the history of our country. This is a global game changer and none too soon, we don't have much time. We all know we're already living in a climate crisis. No one seems to doubt it after this past year.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: You know, Greg, right now, what you've got is months and months of a war that should have been ended supposedly within a few weeks. And now Vladimir Putin's back is against the wall and he's got his finger. He is alleging and threatening against the -- on a nuclear button and he's threatening all of us. And he does have a nuclear arsenal.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I find it interesting that in this, you saw Biden talking about a -- I wonder is 57, $60 billion in arms sent to Ukraine. Does that help or hurt the climate crisis? Just putting it out there.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I mean, it kind of seems like you can't say both things.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You can't tell us we're in a crisis and then keep a war going on with billions and billions of our dollars with, you know, missiles and bombs and trucks. I think these reservist thing, I don't think Putin planned on this. It's a credit to the Ukrainian fighting force and our billions of dollars. But this is a, I think this is a good sign for Ukraine because I don't think millions of Russians are going to be happy that their fathers and their brothers and their sons who were reservists, who may have retired are being called back in to fight in the Ukraine. That's the other thing. I don't think it's comforting to know that your Russian soldiers may not be coming back anytime soon. I mean, you're like, they're not even letting the ones that are there come back unless they're dead. So, this has got to, I mean, to this from a morale perspective, and this is really an information war at this point, it's a war persuasion between two sides. And I think that this is like a blow to Russia to how do they explain this? The morale is going to go downhill.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Well, and you know, Dana, the truth is that with 300,000 I think is the estimate of reservists that they're calling out. And then you've got people moving out of Russia at a record number. This was supposed to be easy.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: And now what we've got is he seems like a mad man.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: So, it's supposed to be, he, I think that either he had bad intelligence or he just assumed it would be easy or he thought the military was going to be -- his military would be a lot more effective than they were, and that the Ukrainians were going to fold. So, none of that happened. And then in the last two weeks, Putin had a pretty rough time of it. Because both the Chinese leader and the Indian leader had meetings last week with him where they said, yes, we're not for this. And you need to figure out a way to wind this down. Then he has pressure from inside his own government. The people that are saying like, how could you let this happen? You're embarrassing us on the world stage, you have to do something. So, he might say something like using a tactical nuclear weapon or worse it could be something. The HIMARS which are the -- are the weapons that we're been providing, they're extremely effective. And they can't deal with that, especially if they're trying to buy weapons from North Korea in order to fight back. However, I maintain that Putin's strongest weapon that he will use against the west he's already deploying, which is to shut off energy. And so, the Ukrainians can do very, very well, but because the west continues to hamstring itself in its energy production, they are going to be in a world of hurt this winter. And we, this is a warning for the United States. We have to have a better policy, so we never get into this position.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Well with this, with this administration I don't know that we're going to have a better policy as it relates to energy. And the truth is, I mean, this guy thinks he can threaten us and that we're afraid of him and the HIMARS weapons that Dana refers to. But he talks about you. You threaten our territorial integrity. You're going to get it.

utterances.speaker: FORD
utterances.utterance: So, energy security is something we're learning a lot more about and the Europeans are learning a lot more about. I don't blame us fully for their challenges. We should be producing more here, but the Europeans are going to have to adopt a different energy posture going forward. Two, who's losing? Seven, eight months ago this conversation, there was a lot of consternation in our conversation about what the administration should be doing or not be doing. There were those that thought that the president was moving too slowly. I gave him the benefit of the doubt. It turns out they were far more right than wrong. There 70, 80, 70 to 80,000 Russians have been killed. They cannot call -- they cannot impose a draft to bring more soldiers into this because as Greg so aptly said, people don't want to do this. I think what Dana said is probably the most important thing is we confront this question right here, which is how the -- how India and China are perceiving Putin at this point. They have been allies of his. India has been on the sidelines, which you can construe as being an ally in this -- in this effort. And China, and the China's leader and Russia's leader got together seven months ago and said there was a limitless nature to their relationship. And then China's leader said, no, I'm I need to back that up a little bit. This is not going as we thought. The question now becomes what happens? What is the -- what is the negotiated out to this? I can't imagine Zelenskyy is going to give up any land. He shouldn't. And it's hard to stomach, to Greg's point, how does Putin look at people in the face there in Russian say we did all of this. We lost all of these troops. We were exposed to not have the military people thought we had, but we're going to back up now. We're at the hard point now, and it will take the Blinkens and the others of the world and our diplomacy corps to help figure out how we get out of this.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Jesse?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Well, I wouldn't rely on the Blinkens to get us out of it.

utterances.speaker: FORD
utterances.utterance: He's our secretary of state.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I understand. But he's not really, if you think about it, what has he done? Where has he been? Dana is right. They'll just freeze the Italians and the Germans if they squeeze the pipeline this winner. I mean, if they have to mobilize more Russians, I mean, what are they going to hand them? A 20-year-old rifle and say aim and squeeze. You're going to give them some crummy boots, whittle the winter comes around. It's they're going to be cannon fodder. This is the worst military performance I've ever seen. And I've been a student of military history.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You have, you have.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: But it's not so much all the weapons that we loaded up to the Ukraine, which obviously made a crucial difference. No one expected. The military tactics to be this terrible from the Russians. The training is awful. Their equipment is old and has cobwebs in it and they can't even communicate. So, it's been a disaster. It's hard to fight insurgency. Look at the American colonists. Look at the Viet col, look at the Afghans. When you're fighting for your own survival in your own backyard and you do have some weapons, you can put a hurting on these invaders. But if I were Putin, I'd say whatever I wanted to say, you could just lie. What are they going to do? Impeach you? What are you worried about your next election? Come on. The guy is a dictator and all of his guys keep having these accidents. Every day you open the paper and another one of Putin's guy slips on a banana peel, gets pushed off of a yacht. I mean, these guys must be really clumsy or they're being assassinated.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I feel, judge, I feel the same way about the U.N.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Let's talk about that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: We are being invaded.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: I agree.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: We're being invaded. It -- we can't move in our city because the U.N. is here.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: It was great when there was COVID and there was no U.N.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, I know. And now they're back.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: (Inaudible) America.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: They're back. They're using all our escort services, all of our taxis.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You can't get an escort.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You can't get an escort.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: And know what else?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Or restaurant.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: And we end up paying for it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Exactly.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: And that's a shame.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: We're paying for the escorts.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Now up next, woke companies are hell bent on cramming their left- wing agenda down your throat, whether you like it or not.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Woke CEOs once again thinking they know best when it comes to what's good for society. The guy who runs personal hygiene brand at Unilever, big fan, says anyone who isn't on the woke train is destroying the world.

utterances.speaker: ALAN JOPE, CEO, UNILEVER
utterances.utterance: Stating the obvious that we have an emergency, we have a climate emergency is becoming an unpopular thing to do. This anti-U.S. sustainability backlash. This anti woke backlash is incredibly dangerous for the world. And the first thing that Unilever will do is we will not back down on this agenda, despite these populous accusations.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And it doesn't stop there. Woke companies are stealing a page from Biden's COVID playbook, call anything a crisis to get cash. Watch.

utterances.speaker: DAMILOLA OGUNBIYI, CO-CHAIR, UN-ENERGY
utterances.utterance: I first recognize it's a crisis. And you know, just how we found is that 14 or 17 trillion for COVID. The money must be there somewhere.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: The money must be there somewhere.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It's our money.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: It grows on trees.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: What did you hear? that's something happens.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: that's why they're pro-climate. So, we got more trees.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Exactly. We need more trees. We can get more money. ESG forces companies to prioritize political causes over their shareholders. that's what it does. And there's a lot of commentary now about the E part of ESG, the environmental part, but I think the S, the social part is also really interesting. Because, for example, if a company does not take, doesn't allow for reimbursement of travel for an abortion, the employees at that company might declare it a hostile work environment. And then in the ESG guidelines, you can get docked. And that hurts the company. Or you're like Delta Airlines. And you take a ridiculous position about the Georgia voting law because you don't want to get docked even despite the facts. So, I think that you -- there's a lot to be said here about investing in a -- in a way that protects the environment and is good for the -- well, I guess the shareholders. But the whole idea of the social notion of it and the environmental piece of it is really, I think, leading this down a path where you have corporations then that will be speaking for the left, even if they don't want to.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Did my people at Delta do something we don't like? I'm going to talk to the CEO though --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: No, you remember --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: No, no. Delta is a good company. Who's --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That's right. Yes, they are.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Who's the question going to?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Let's go to you, Judge.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: OK, good. All right, look --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Are you ready?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Here's the bottom line. Companies should be concerned about their bottom line. They have a fiduciary responsibility to their shareholders, to their bottom line. And all this other stuff, they may feel good about it. It has nothing to do with the bottom line. So, don't interfere with my ability to make money. I'm not going to buy any stock in your company. I'm not even going to buy your products anymore with this woke nonsense. And the perfect example is Disney's public approval plummeted from 77 percent to 33 percent when they decided to get involved in the Don't Say Gay Law in in Florida. Now why, why? That's none of their business. It has nothing to do with their company. Because they let a few employees tried to determine what the company is going to do in a social and environmental way. Government is about the bottom line and nothing else.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: They make Lever 2000 I hear, the soap. It's the last time I use Lever 2000.

utterances.speaker: FORD JR.
utterances.utterance: Are you talking to me?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I'm going to vote with my personal hygiene products.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Soap. Vote with my soap.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Vote with my soap. How did I not know that one?

utterances.speaker: FORD JR.
utterances.utterance: So, when -- it's interesting to me. When Republicans don't like something that goes about --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Careful, Harold. Careful.

utterances.speaker: FORD JR.
utterances.utterance: No, no, no -- you call it woke when Democrats don't like something that's being said or that's being done, they want to cancel it. We all got to take a breath here and take a step back because in the context, the way we talk about these things, both Elon Musk and Steve Jobs who I think are the greatest visionaries -- business visionaries of my lifetime would have probably been called woke or been attempting to cancel. Musk wanted to make electric cars. And I differ with Dana. I have a little different point of view about the - -

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: What?

utterances.speaker: FORD JR.
utterances.utterance: -- about the environmental, social, and governance piece. I don't think it's all political. I think there's something to be said for. But under your analogy, you might call Musk woke, you might call Steve --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Why.

utterances.speaker: FORD JR.
utterances.utterance: Because Musk said we're going to take the combustible engine and make it obsolete. We're going to do something different.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: But --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: That was his company.

utterances.speaker: FORD JR.
utterances.utterance: I know. But it's still this guy's saying, look, I'm not here to - - I'm just saying look, we all got to --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Yes, you are here to argue.

utterances.speaker: FORD JR.
utterances.utterance: We got to take a step back here. Jobs who revolutionized the way we consume -- buy and consume groceries, music, other entertainment content. He might have been called woke. He might have been -- he might have been -- someone might have tried to cancel him because they didn't like how easy or how free it might have been. All I'm saying is some people deserve to be called woke. Some people deserve to be canceled. But before we quickly and just reflexively do it, I think we ought to just take a breath. Everybody, Democrats, Republicans, Independents alike, and assess things without the political lens that I think we all seem to conveniently and reflexively do.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: If Elon Musk wants to start a company for electric cars, he shouldn't be able to do it. He is not --

utterances.speaker: FORD JR.
utterances.utterance: He did. He's the richest man in the world.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: He's not taking a company and changing it. Go ahead.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: The important thing here is to define what we're talking about. And Dana got to it, but I just want to expand it because people at home probably don't know what ESG is, right? It stands for Environment, Social and Governance issues. And it's a -- it's a corporate policy that's being instituted in some companies, mainly large companies, because they can -- they can shoulder the burden that small companies can't. This policy exists independent of its shareholders and its customers. It actually gets between them, right? It shifts the attention onto social justice and climate issue, again, to your point, putting politics over profits. So, if I were a shareholder, I would be livid. I would sell my stock immediately. I would only invest in companies that do not participate in this. There's another little uglier part going on here. Unilever is like a really, really, really wealthy person who brags about giving to charity, even though it's a tiny percentage, they never give enough to feel it. So, what they're asking and demanding of other companies, they can't do. So, all these -- all these big giant companies, they are virtue signaling. They're saying, look how good we are. We care about social issues, and we care about -- they're only doing it to cover their asses and we know that. That's all this -- that's all the woke corporate policy is, it's to keep the activism out of their front and backyard. This is a virtue signal, just like a super expensive graduate degree is for a wealthy person, a wealthy dumb person who wants to buy a degree so they look super smart. That's all this is. This makes them look compassionate. That's -- it's like a six-figure liberal arts degree that a rich kid gets and then they get their debt canceled and we end up paying. That's what ESG is. ESG is simply a corporate policy that hurts the shareholder and the customer. Don't forget that because they don't want you to know that. They want you to remain confused.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Can I add one thing? So -- and then you get a score. So, your company gets a score and they'll put that on their LinkedIn, right?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Like, so for younger employees that want to come work at the company, they say, well, our ESG score is a 98. Oh, well, wow. They must be amazing.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's a virtue signal.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's a pure virtue -- I'm sure Fox isn't doing this, right, Jesse? I hope not. Because if they are, I change my mind. This is the greatest thing.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Are you saying, we have to give so much to charity that it hurts?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. I never heard that before. Ahead, the ladies of The View lobbing and ethnic attack at Nikki Haley.

utterances.speaker: FORD JR.
utterances.utterance: The ladies of The View are back and causing more controversy. Co- host Sunny Hostin taking a cheap shot at former U.N. Ambassador Nikki Haley, accusing her of trying to hide her Indian heritage.

utterances.speaker: ALYSSA FARAH GRIFFIN, CO-HOST, THE VIEW
utterances.utterance: I'd love to see Nikki Haley. I'd love to see Liz Cheney. I'd love to see --

utterances.speaker: SUNNY HOSTIN, CO-HOST, THE VIEW
utterances.utterance: And Nikki Haley, the chameleon.

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.utterance: Nikki Haley was incredibly effective governor of South Carolina.

utterances.speaker: HOSTIN
utterances.utterance: What is her real name again? There's some of us that can be chameleons and decide not to embrace our ethnicity so that we can pass to the real --

utterances.speaker: GRIFFIN
utterances.utterance: I don't think that's fair.

utterances.speaker: SARA HAINES, HOST, THE VIEW
utterances.utterance: Sunny, you go by a different name.

utterances.speaker: FORD JR.
utterances.utterance: And Ambassador Haley fired right back.

utterances.speaker: NIKKI HALEY, FORMER U.S. AMBASSADOR TO THE UNITED NATION
utterances.utterance: They can't stand the fact that a minority female would be a conservative Republican. I embrace my Indian heritage. I have written two books that describe the struggles that my family had, what it was like growing up. When they go after something like your name or your looks, they don't have anything else. That shows you're winning and I'll take that win all day long. What happened on the view is, it's Democrats that are racist. These liberal extremists are the ones that are racist. They're the ones that won't -- that think minorities are incapable of going to the DMV to get an ID to vote. They're the ones that are racist that say minority parents are incapable of finding the school for their children.

utterances.speaker: FORD JR.
utterances.utterance: Greg, you had a reaction to that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I think this is something everybody should remember. When you live in a bubble you can never see around the corner. I came up with that this morning.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I love that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Isn't that amazing? Whether you're left or your right, if you're in a bubble, you will always be surprised by your own curated ignorance. And that's what happened to Sunny. You would think somebody with a made up name like Sunny would be able to see around the corner when she criticizes Nikki for having what she thought was a made up name, but it's not, it's a real name. If you live outside of bubble, you would be aware that you can actually see the second step. But there are -- the problem with The View is that they're an entry level version of awareness. They can't -- because they're a bubble within a bubble, so they have no -- she was like totally surprised. The girl goes, but your name is Sunny and she was -- well, that's different. I mean, no one can pronounce my name. And it's like, no, no, no, you should have seen that coming. But you can't because you live in a bubble. You can't see around the corners, because you're trapped. And it is so funny that her name is Sunny. We've said it before, but she's as sunny as death row. And I would just advise The View to find a smart conservative for their show because they need to have somebody there that can kind of inform them. There is absolutely, Harold, no learning curve on The View. Have you ever noticed this? For a show that makes so many mistakes? It's only getting worse. It's like when we make a mistake, the show always gets better because we learn from it. They just get further and further down into the morass of their own incompetence and ignorance. Frankly, I'm appalled.

utterances.speaker: FORD JR.
utterances.utterance: Dana?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Like --

utterances.speaker: FORD JR.
utterances.utterance: Oh, no, Jesse --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Like when you thought (INAUDIBLE) was dead, the show got much better after that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, yes. I remember when I thought that Veal was a different animal. Remember?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes, you didn't know what animal.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I didn't know what animal. And then when I learned, I instantly became more aware of what a veal is. It's actually a calf.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Baby calf.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You're still learning.

utterances.speaker: FORD JR.
utterances.utterance: Dana, if you remember the topic we're on.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I do. Because this is the other thing. I'm just like, do they read? I mean, this attack on Nikki Haley has been made so many times and been debunked so many times that if you follow politics at all, you know that. Nikki means little one. It's on her birth certificate.

utterances.speaker: FORD JR.
utterances.utterance: Isn't her middle name Nikki?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes, it's her middle name. And she goes -- she goes -- I don't remember the first name, but Nikki is her middle. And then her last name is Haley because she got married and adopted her husband's name.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Husband's name.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And the thing is -- funny to me about The View as well is why not just celebrate the fact that she was an amazing governor. You can disagree with her, whatever, but she's accomplished a lot of things. And so they have to tear down for somebody that's not even true. It's bizarre.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: It's -- there is so much hate that's coming from the left, they have to make it up. And amazing part of it is when she says -- when they say your name -- you know you call yourself Sunny. And she says, that's because Americans are too stupid or undereducated to be able to say Asuncion. I mean, really? We're stupid? And therefore we can't say your name and therefore she shouldn't be able to say the name that's on her birth certificate. You know, no -- it really is classic. Point the finger at someone and three are pointing back at yourself.

utterances.speaker: FORD JR.
utterances.utterance: Are talking to me. I can give it to Jesse now.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: I forget it's your turn.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Her name on the certificate is Nimrata Nikki Randhawa. And she's gone by Nikki since she was a baby. So, I don't think she calls herself Nikki as a bailey -- as a baby because she knew 40 years later she might run for office. Or maybe she did. Maybe she did. But who cares because Jon Stewart, his real name is Jonathan Stuart Leibowitz. He wanted to deemphasize the Jewishness.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: What about Whoopi Goldberg's name?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: She emphasized the Jewishness --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Caryn Johnson.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Caryn Johnson.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No, her name is Caryn Johnson.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Caryn Johnson, added a Goldberg. I mean, I'm Jewish. It's Jesse Silverstein. I took that away because I thought maybe I'd go more places with Watters.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I don't believe you.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You don't believe me?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Because I'm not telling the truth.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Exactly. Thank God I smell it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Now, liberals say you can change your gender but you can't change your name?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Oh, that's good.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You can identify as an owl. I can go into the woman's room on Monday and the men's room on Tuesday but you're saying you can't use your middle name? That is crazy.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: I though your name was Scooter.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Scooter.

utterances.speaker: FORD JR.
utterances.utterance: "THE FASTEST" is up next.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Welcome back. Time for "THE FASTEST." First up, the anticipation is over. The Space Force has released its official song and some say it's out of this world.

utterances.speaker: CHOIR (singing)
utterances.utterance: There's no limit to our sky. Standing guard both night and day. We're the Space Force from on high.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: So, no word yet on how alien music critics are responding to this space jam. What do you think of this?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Is that real? Are we being pranked? Because I swear that doesn't - - that's not real. That can't be real.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I think it's real.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Was that done by like, you know, like, a music teacher from the local high school or something?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: It's called Semper Supra, Always Above. And apparently, it reflects the values and traditions of the Space Force. Harold?

utterances.speaker: FORD JR.
utterances.utterance: It's terrible. I mean, that's nice but, you know --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: It doesn't really strike fear in our enemies though or like, it does it inspire you to like, support --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: To join?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's like a newsreel. It's like a new -- it's like a newsreel footage from the 1940s.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: I was just going to say, it's a 1950s beat. I mean, it's like, where's that from?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Listen, guys, 100 years from now, the only thing left of the Trump presidency will be Space Force and the wall, so show some respect.

utterances.speaker: FORD JR.
utterances.utterance: OK, Scooter.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Oh, we have another one. OK, up next, what's worse than listening to someone learning how to play an instrument? How about an entire flight of people? This is horrible. Southwest Airlines getting mocked after giving out ukuleles to Hawaiian-bound passengers. But what about the people who just want to sleep? I -- you know, I'm sensitive to noise, Judge. I would have gone insane.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: I would have hung myself.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: I mean, people go on an airplane. If you go into Hawaii, you got a long trip. OK, you want to read a book, you want to sleep. You have people playing ukuleles. People are drinking and playing. Can you imagine what that's like?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I have to disagree with you because this is based -- this is based on a really important internal truth. No one on a flight to Hawaii is in a bad mood. You should think about that. Like, they're like sitting there going like -- how can you get upset when you're going to Hawaii? Give me a ukulele.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: OK, OK, I can see that. Would you play the ukulele?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: No, I'd get the ukulele after I land in Hawaii. They give you the lay, they give you the ukulele, and then you're set. Not on the plane.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Right. And then, Harold, what would you do with --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: What if you have kids?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: -- kids if you give them a ukulele? You should take it away.

utterances.speaker: FORD JR.
utterances.utterance: I have -- I'm with Greg. I have a ball on this plane. My kids --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I'm going to smash that ukulele right over your head.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Well, let me just tell you. When we all --

utterances.speaker: FORD JR.
utterances.utterance: This is Scooter Watters, ladies and gentlemen.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Let's just see. When we go to the Patriot Awards in November who's flying with who. I'm with the judge. "ONE MORE THING" is up next.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: "ONE MORE THING." Judge.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: OK. Have you ever lost a dog? Well, there's a new way to locate your dog and the family in England found out. They had a missing dog, Hilda. And a woman decided that she would send her drone to find and locate the puppy for free as a bad storm approach. She made sure she located it and she said she does it purely for her love of dogs.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That's good.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: And even has a Facebook group where users can share lost dog post. And she can share happy endings.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Don't.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: What?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Don't.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: What does that mean?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I don't know. But you know what? It's my turn. So, tonight we have Jared Kushner, Mike Baker, Kat Timpf, and Tyrus. This is going to be a great show. We've been kicking butt all week. And my live shows: Saturday, October 1st, Foxwoods Casino in Connecticut with Jamie Lissow opening. And then I'll be in Sugarland, Texas, November 19. Kat Timpf will be opening for me. And that -- go to ggutfeld.com. Let's do this, speaking of lot. Navigation tips. This is much like yours, Judge. How did this happen? Take a look at this guy. This is a seal. This is a sea lion.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Oh, stop it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That's a sea lion that is now on a dairy farm in Australia. How did this big fat cow -- because that is an ocean cow -- appeared with all these other cows? No one really knows. But he did find his way back to the sea.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Really? No one knows.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No. No one really knows.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Oh, that's great video.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Oh, you know, Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I do know, but I'm not telling you. I'm not telling you. He was airdropped. Oh, excuse me, Judge. (INAUDIBLE).

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: It's all right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Dana?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: OK, let me tell you this 10-year-old from England, Nottinghamshire or something. I can't say that one. Anyway, this is his first time doing a double backflip. See his reaction. He didn't even realize he could do it. Super, super cute.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: No way.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: He's so cute. Let's see it again. Oh, boom. There you go.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Oh, he's so happy.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Isn't that pretty good? Don't try that at home, folks. Also, a big congratulations to our colleague and friend Trace Gallagher. He has just been named the permanent anchor of "FOX NEWS @ NIGHT." So, he will be taking your hand off from you now.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Trace.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Wow.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: An amazing --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Congratulations.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Amazing water skier.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I bet you didn't know that.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I did know that.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes, but he'll be doing it from LA, so won't even really be that late.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: It will be primetime.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Yes. That's smart.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You know what? That's wrong. He shouldn't do there. Is that what you're saying, Jesse?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You don't want him to do it now?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: No. I'm just saying, it's like not as big of a deal that he has to stay up late.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Wow.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: That's so -- congratulations.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Because of the time difference, but congrats.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No, he's right. All right, Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I am right. Here's a lesson to all you criminals out there. I know you watch the show. You love it. Always have a getaway route. This thief stole a car in Washington and took a wrong turn and wound up in a big bowl of wet concrete, got stuck. And just to say -- it's on the sheet. The driver was a woman. This is not to say that all women drivers are bad drivers. This particular woman was a bad driver. Tonight on "JESSE WATTERS PRIMETIME," AOC says we have to open the borders because migrants will have the babies that Americans won't.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Wow.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Oh, my goodness.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: If only there was a name for that, what's that, Harold?

utterances.speaker: FORD JR.
utterances.utterance: Two quick things. One, I had a great pal who had his cancer screening, and thank God they discovered it and it's going to help him. Everybody gets your cancer screenings whatever age you are. Detect it early, you get a much better chance of beating it. A different note. Aaron Judge hit his 60th home run this season last night against the pirates. He's second all-time as a Yankee doing it. He's the fastest Yankee to get the 60. He's one to tie Roger Maris, two have the AL Record, and he's got the leading batting average in RB -- leading RBIs in the league as well. He's in really en route to be the Triple Crown and maybe be the MVP. Congrats to him and hopes he gets it soon.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: RBI, MVP.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: How far behind Barry Bonds?

utterances.speaker: FORD JR.
utterances.utterance: So, those guys, they think about them a little differently.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Asterisk. There's an asterisk.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That's it for us. Watch your mouth, Dana. "SPECIAL REPORT" up next. Hey, Bret!
